event.name: NEBULA_LIGHT_MONK_GRAVE
event.text: Though a nebula is still present at this beacon, you can't help but notice strange readings from the nearby moon. With these, you deduct a ship has landed there, but you can't tell what kind.

As you pilot closer to the moon, you're able to make out a Duskbringer vessel on the surface. Despite perhaps your better judgement, you decide to land anyways, and trail your way towards the ship. When you arrive, you find an arrangement of small stones and an armored Zoltan kneeling over them, crying.

The Zoltan turns to you, and his composure changes from distraught to disheveled and angry. "Renegade pigs? Get out of here, this is hallowed ground!" You pocket your weapons and raise your arms, to signal you come in peace. The Zoltan sighs and goes back to staring at the unmarked graves.
"The Federation history books don't tell many stories of the Zoltans' involvement in Federation Wars. I think most people choose to believe we played little to no part at all. But hundreds of thousands, if not more, proud Zoltans gave their lives fighting for the Federation and the Galaxy in the Fed-Mantis War, the anti-Inquisitions, and the Civil War. And what thanks do they get? An unmarked grave here, on some moon in the middle of nowhere in a sector no one but monks visit. And the Ministry is fine with it. They'd prefer people forget our involvement in those wars, as part of their whole... 'non-violence' agenda." The Zoltan spits on the ground away from the graves. "It's shameful, really."

The Zoltan wipes away a tear. "Thank you. I don't know how much you really mean it, but I appreciate it. It's not often I meet people who care to even listen to me without shouting that I'm a radical. I cannot offer much, but maybe I have something that can begin to make up for my mistakes."

choice.text: Mention that the Ministry never showed up during or after the Last Stand.

event.text: "Really shows how little you understand history. The Ministry SENT forces to aid the Federation during the Civil War - and we were sent to fight on the backwater fronts in the middle of nowhere-space handling pirates more than Rebels. The Ministry couldn't afford to keep sending troops when internal affairs were a mess and the Rebels always a threat, so they pulled the plug. And of course, when the war was over, the Zoltans were painted as cowards and traitors, unwilling to serve the very organization they had helped found." The Zoltan turns away from you and goes back to staring at the graves. With nothing else to add, you figure it's best to leave.

"Not even a single mention of the Zoltans. Not one. There's millions of humans, but not a single Zoltan or Engi. And why do you think that is? The same people who paid the bills for those memorials were the rich shady Union scumbags who were playing golf with Wentworth before the war. They didn't WANT to mention the Zoltans on it. And so they didn't. It's why people like Devorak the Deathless turned against the Federation."

choice.text: It is shameful, how they buried your history.

event.text: The Zoltan wipes away a tear. "Thank you. I don't know how much you really mean it, but I appreciate it. It's not often I meet people who care to even listen to me without shouting that I'm a radical. I cannot offer much, but maybe I have something that can begin to make up for my mistakes."

choice.text: You still could have done more.

event.text: "Again and again, the galaxy only seems to prove itself to be a cycle. Why do I even bother trying to atone for the wrongs of the past, if people will spit in my face and ignore everything I say regardless? Fine, if you want things to be this way... then let them be this way!"

choice.text: (Devorak) "In the heat of our fury we all make mistakes."

event.text: The Duskbringer double takes when he realizes Devorak is amongst your crew. They bow towards each other. "Oh my - Devorak! I didn't realize-" Devorak cuts him off. "It is okay. I have made many - too many, mistakes in my life. We were all angry at the Federation, and for good reason. But we must never let our anger turn to violence. We must protest, but we must protest peacefully. How else will progress be made, if not without bloodshed? These are the lessons we must teach ourselves." Still speechless, the young Duskbringer introduces himself as Dovan and requests to join your crew.

choice.text: Leave some scrap as an offering on one of the graves.

event.text: It's a strange gesture for sure, but it's the best you can do with the limited resources you have. The Duskbringer seems to appreciate it regardless. As he wipes away a tear, he says, "T-thanks. I haven't known Renegades to be the sensitive type. Sensitive as in, situationally aware. But perhaps it's unfair to judge a book by its cover." He stands back up and sticks out his hand. "The name's Dovan. I joined the Duskbringers at a dark point in my life, when tensions between the Ministry and Union were at their highest, and everything about the Federation felt.. bleak. But now I realize it was all a mistake. The Federation, for all its flaws, is the only thing capable of uniting the galaxy. The Duskbringers, the Rebels, organizations like those... they're only going to tear this entire Multiverse apart. Do you mind if I go with you? My crew doesn't ever need to know..."

choice.text: (Orchid Children) Leave some flowers on the graves.

event.text: Knowing just what's appropriate for this situation, you run back to your ship and fetch the Orchid children corpses, then scatter them across the graves. At first the Duskbringer thinks you're giving a nice gesture, until he realizes what they really are. "WHAT IN THE NAME OF THE GREAT EYE ARE YOU DOING?! WHAT IS WRONG WITH YOU!?" The Duskbringer runs back to his ship and orders all of his crew to open fire on you immediately.

choice.text: Take no chances - kill the Duskbringer.

event.text: You draw your weapon and shoot the Zoltan from a distance. He dies almost instantly, dissipating into nothing but his armor. You can't help but feel that was a bit unnecessary, but it's too late to undo it now.
For all you know this could be a trap. Better not to approach.
Unfortunately, while in the middle of robbing the ship the Duskbringer returns to find you, and raises the alarm! Get ready for combat!
Your crew sneak aboard the Duskbringer ship and loot it. You don't find much besides a spare weapon which you take.

event.name: NEBULA_MONK_FREE_CREW
event.text: The nearby monastery hails you. A scrawny monk appears on the viewscreen. "Hello. I recently joined this Monastery, but I soon found a life of isolation out here in these nebulas is not for me. Would you perhaps allow me to come with you? I'm dedicated to my pacifist beliefs, but I can be useful in other ways!"

choice.text: No thanks, we don't need any more crew.

event.text: "Oh... ok." You end the call and carry on.

event.name: NEBULA_MONK_CONVERT
event.text: A Zoltan Monastery has been constructed at this beacon. They welcome you, offering a tour of their temple.

The 'tour' ends up being less of a tour and more of a long sermon about the Monk's religion. You find it rather boring, but one of your crew are convinced. To your surprise, they want to stay behind and join the monks!
Your crew waves goodbye. The Monks sympathize with you, understanding what a hard decision that must have been. As a consolation, they repair your hull and upgrade your reactor for free.

removeCrew.text: You cannot clone your crew, as they are not dead.

event.text: You comfort your crew, explaining that the mission is more important, and that they can return to the monks when you've saved this reality.

choice.text: You have much better things to do.

event.text: You decide not to tour the monastery.

event.name: NEBULA_MONK_BEGGAR
event.text: An old, hunched over Monk materializes on your ship, hands reaching out in the shape of a cup. "Hello travellers, I am but a humble Zoltan looking for some spare scrap to make it through my day. Life out here is hard, I'm sure you understand."
You hand over the money to the old monk.
"Oh thank you, you are so kind." He beams away, without another word.
"Oh thank you, you are so kind. Perhaps I shall stay with you... you seem like such nice people."
"Oh thank you, you are so kind. I do not have much, but back in my day I used to know a thing or two about reactors. Maybe I can do some work on yours."
"It is ok... I understand." The monk beams away without another word.

The Monk stands upright, immediately looking several years younger. He throws off his robe, revealing a blaster! "Tsk tsk captain, you should have been more giving!" Several more Zoltans appear, and a pirate ship approaches.

event.name: NEBULA_MONK_STRANDED_FED
event.text: You're shocked to see a Federation ship stuck at this beacon, with their engines in disrepair. "Oh, you've caught us at a bad time. Or actually... a rather fortunate time, for you. We need scrap to repair our engines, and the Monks here have been useless at helping us. We would be willing to sell you supplies for scrap."

choice.text: Give them scrap for their repairs. [-25~]

event.text: "Oh, wow! Thank you so much. We can't let this go unpaid though. Here, while travelling this sector we collected detailed maps of our findings, it should be of assistance. Have some fuel too, we have more than enough, it's only our engines that need fixing."

choice.text: We aren't looking to buy anything.

event.text: You apologize to the Fed ship and carry on your way.

event.name: NEBULA_MONK_GHOST
event.text: The nearby Monk ship appears to be moving around strangely, almost as if they aren't sure how to pilot it. A single rusty missile launcher has been mounted on it as well, uncharacteristic of the usually peaceful monks.

The Monks don't respond to your hails vocally, but rather a message. "Hello. This ship is no longer under ownership by Zoltan Monks. We are Ghosts. This ship is under-armed, we are low on missiles. Can you give some?"
"Your gift is appreciated. Please accept this token of gratitude." You expect scrap or perhaps some fuel, but instead a Ghost crew member materializes on your ship!
"Unexpectedly high quantity of ammo. Please accept this token of gratitude." You expect scrap or perhaps some fuel, but instead a Ghost crew member materializes on your ship!

choice.text: If they're low on missiles, that means they're an easy target!

event.text: You refuse to help the Ghosts, but rather attack them instead.
You apologize to the Ghosts and carry on with your mission.
You ignore the strange monks and move past.

event.name: NEBULA_LIGHT_MONK_ANNOYED
event.text: A small Zoltan temple has been constructed on a nearby planet, which looks otherwise completely barren.
"Hello friends. I have received your hail, but I'm afraid I am busy meditating. Safe travels." They end the call.
"I apologize, but I have nothing to offer. Have a nice day." They end the call once again.
"Maybe you did not hear me. I said I have nothing to offer. Have a nice day." They end the call once again.
"Please stop. I have already told you, I have nothing to offer." They end the call once again.
"How many more times will you do this? I am not going to give you anything. Do not hail me again." They end the call once again.

"Fine! If you want something so bad, take this!" You wait in anticipation, but instead of a reward, a hostile Automated ship rockets up towards you, colliding with the hull and immediately entering combat mode.

choice.text: (Monk Crew) Have your Monk hail them.

event.text: "Ah, one of us. I will send an automated vessel up to repair your hull. Have a nice day."
You decide not to bother the temple or the Monks inside.

event.name: NEBULA_MONK_CHASE
event.text: You notice what appears to be the exterior of a ship slipping through the clouds before it disappears.
Whatever it was, you aren't interested in following.
It appears the ship was pirates! They aren't happy to see you and arm their guns.
It appears the ship was Duskbringers! They aren't happy to see you and arm their guns.
It appears the ship were simple Monks. They say hello before slipping away once again.

event.name: NEBULA_MONK_DUSKBRINGERS
event.text: You spot a strange sight, a Duskbringer ship conversing with Zoltan Monks! You can only imagine they're demanding the Monks hand over supplies in return for their lives...

choice.text: Rescue the Monks from the Duskbringers.

event.text: You interrupt the ships to attack the Duskbringers.

choice.text: Wait for the Duskbringers to leave and contact the Monks.

event.text: Once the Duskbringers jump away, you approach the Monks and question them about the encounter. The Monks chuckle. "No no, they would not hurt us. They are our friends. Though we disapprove of their radical beliefs, we still support them when we can." You nod your head and end the call.
You can't make assumptions. You have no idea what's truly going on over there, and you shouldn't interrupt just in case.

event.name: NEBULA_MONK_HOSTAGES
event.text: It appears the nearby monastery is in trouble! A Slug hacker is holding them hostage and broadcasting a message to all nearby ships, demanding they pay an absurd ransom for the Monks.
"Oh, sssso you want to brawl? Prepare to die then!"
"Ahhhh, at lasssst sssssomeone paysss our reasssonable price!" The Hackers relinquish control over the Monastery and jump away.
"Thank you friend. We thought this was how we would die. The Hackers have held control over us for weeks, and many of us have already starved. May we last few survivors come with you?"

choice.text: (Mind Control) Try to mind control the Hackers to let them go.

event.text: The mind control proves completely pointless, as the Hackers are Slugs. Even worse, you've announced your location and the ship moves in to attack.

choice.text: (Mind Affecting Weapon) Try to mind control the Hackers.

event.text: The mind control proves completely pointless, as the Hackers are Slugs. Even worse, you've announced your location and the ship moves in to attack.
You can't waste your money here. When the Hackers realize no-one is going to pay they'll leave the Monks alone anyways... probably...

event.name: NEBULA_MONK_PROVERB
event.text: You receive a strange hail from the ship here. "As the wise Solay Voltar once said, he who lies with the voracious bat-dogs awakes with the space-fleas of Gammos 6."

The Monk sighs. "It's a proverb. It means one whom associates themselves with those who are devoid of morals shall find themselves in a similar predicament. A warning, so I should say, for one's own situation, living within the Federation."

choice.text: (Monk Crew) "A warning well headed, but not without risks of its own."

event.text: The other Monk nods, and the two launch into a long philosophical discussion about moral principles. You can't understand a word of what they say, but it seems your Monk has convinced the other of your wisdom and they come aboard.

choice.text: How dare you insult the Federation! Attack!

event.text: The Monks refuse to fight, letting you fire on their ship.

choice.text: Ignore them and continue on your way.

event.text: You put the Monk's words out of your mind.

event.name: NEBULA_MONK_LOST_MAN
event.text: A Zoltan lifepod is drifting out here in space. The life-pod has minor damage, but the wreck of a peace-keeper ship drifts nearby as well.

A gasping Zoltan is brought aboard, still wearing their peace-keeper armor. "T-Thank you for saving me! We were tasked with transporting a Monk ship carrying an important Zoltan operative who's undercover. Everything was fine, until a mercenary hired by the Duskbringers showed up and obliterated our ship. The monks fled, but it won't be long before the Mercenaries catch up. I'll upload their co-ordinates to the computer, I hope you will help me."

choice.text: Ignore the lifepod and just scrap the ship.

event.text: You fly past the lifepod and move to the wreckage, which provides some scrap and supplies.

event.name: MONK_LOST_MAN_QUEST

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: Location of an undercover operative in peril given by a rescued Peacekeeper.

event.text: It appears you've arrived just in time. The Mercenary ship mentioned earlier is assaulting the Monk ship. They won't last long, so you intercept their attack and prepare to destroy the mercenaries.

event.name: NEBULA_MONK_CONVOY
event.text: A Monk ship hails you. "As you may know, our religion forbids us from participating in violent acts. However, we have had terrible luck with pirates in this sector. Could you help transport us to our destination?"
The Monks transmit the co-ordinates to their destination.
You apologize and explain you are not an escort. The Monks say they understand and carry on.
You've arrived at the destination, but a pirate ship is in your path! You hail the Monks to warn them and prepare to battle.

The Monks jump in shortly after. "You have done well. It is a shame we must rely on violent savages such as yourself, but this is a cruel and uncaring galaxy. Please accept this monetary donation as thanks."

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_MONK_ZOLTAN
textList.text: Monks aren't the only Zoltan ships to be found here. A Zoltan vessel admiring the scenery spots you, and somehow feels threatened by your presence enough to retaliate violently!
"What are you? Pirates? Mercenaries? You have come here to harm the Monks, have you not? Prepare to meet your end!" A confused Zoltan ship moves in to attack.

A Zoltan ship slips out of the nebula, its weapons drawn. It must have already been in the middle of a fight, and now that it has stumbled across you, it mistakes you for its previous attacker and locks on to attack.

A Zoltan ship comes lumbering drunkenly out of the nebula. It scrapes against your ship, though luckily it only does superficial damage. Still, in their strange stupor, the Zoltans blame you for the collision, and activate their weapons!

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_ZOLTAN_AUTO_MONK
textList.text: "This is a holy place. You are surely not welcome here." The mysterious voice is followed by gunfire as an Auto-ship approaches!
"Possible threat detected. Risk evaluation suggests immediate termination." Your radars show a hostile ship approaching fast!
The Zoltans value the security of this sector highly, so it's not surprising their Auto-ships are on high alert to attack any ships they don't recognize!

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_MONK_PIRATE
textList.text: A pirate ship lingers at this beacon, attacking you on sight. It's no surprise however, this sector is a pirate magnet as the Monks rarely defend themselves.
It appears a pirate ship was waiting for you in the nebula!
"What are you, one of them Monk's protectors or somethin? Hah!" An arrogant pirate ship slips out from the nebula and attacks you.
Despite the disapproval from the Monks, pirates still visit and plague this sector. It appears you have encountered a rather nasty ship here looking for a fight.

event.name: NEBULA_ENCOUNTER_MANTIS_MONK
event.text: You catch chatter on the nearby Mantis ship. "Look that one, not Monk. Must have good things onboard, we will take them." Since there's no other ships around, it's safe to assume they're referring to you!

event.name: NEBULA_ENCOUNTER_SLUG_MONK
event.text: It seems the Monk presence in this nebulas has disturbed its natural residents, the Slugs! An irritated Slug ship looking to retake their territory spots you and approaches.

event.name: NEBULA_ENCOUNTER_MONK_SMUGGLER_INTERCEPT
event.text: A smuggler ship is attempting to sneak its way through this sector. However, when they spot you, they don't take chances and attack!

event.name: NEBULA_ENCOUNTER_MONK_SMUGGLER_QUEST

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: You've retrieved coordinates from a defeated Smuggler ship that lead here.

event.text: You arrive at the co-ordinates of the Smuggler's client, but they appear to be Monks! Very unusual...
You hail the Monks, but instead a gruff looking pirate responds. "Ah damn, it's the Feds! Prepare the guns men!"
You ignore the monks and move past.

event.name: NEBULA_MONK_RIFT_FIGHT
event.text: You come to a quiet part of Zoltan space and encounter an ancient Zoltan wise man who claims to have harnessed the power of a spatial rift, but seems to have been driven completely mad by the power. He's obviously lying, but his madness is most certainly real, as is the rift. "Choose your doom. I have a wide variety of options," he demands.

choice.text: (Reality Manipulator) Seize control of the rift.

event.text: "What- what have you done??? NOOOOOOOOO!" The Zoltan falls to his knees, utterly defeated as the rift in the distance slowly closes and the environment returns to normal. Terrified of your much more real power, the Zoltan submits to your service.
"You like a challenge. So be it!" A wormhole forms and a confused, angry Mantis ship hurtles toward you!
"Do not be fooled, Federation, by a soft underbelly." You detect a wormhole opening up, and seconds later a Slug ship is attacking from the other direction!
"A hardened foe for a hardened veteran." You detect a wormhole opening up, and a Rock ship appears with guns blazing. It appears they were in combat when they were thrust across space-time.
"An unusually masochistic request, but one I shall grant." You detect a wormhole opening up, and a Lanius ship emerges. Hungry for scrap, the ship attacks.
"Do not judge a book by its cover, some foes are stronger than they might appear." You detect a wormhole opening up, and an Orchid ship emerges. Confused, they mistake you for an enemy and attack!
The Zoltan is quiet for a moment, and then whispers, "Are you sure? Well, so be it then." A huge wormhole opens, and from within it looms an Obelisk ship, prepared for war.

event.name: ZOLTAN_RIFT_SUCCESS
event.text: When he sees you have emerged victorious, the Zoltan wise man enters a rage. Rifts threaten to tear space apart until, instead, the Zoltan implodes, sending a blast wave of scrap and salvage dragged here from distant worlds in your direction.

event.name: MONK_WEAPON
event.text: A monk ship resides here. "We were tidying up this region and we happened to find an awful cache containing a violent weapon! We have no need of such a thing, but if you would make a donation to our cause, we would be happy to let you take it off our hands."

choice.text: Offer some scrap for the weapon.

event.text: "Wonderful! We will put this scrap to good use. Go in peace."

choice.text: (Monk Crew) Pledge to use the weapon responsibly for a discount.

event.text: "Since you are of the faith, we will trust your word. Go in peace."

choice.text: Attack them, maybe you can get it for free.

event.text: The monks respond, regret in their voices. "So it's true, then... those who use violent means cannot be reasoned with..."

choice.text: Tell them you don't want it either.

event.text: "We understand how you feel. Perhaps we will throw it into a star, or present it to the Great Eye."

event.name: MONK_ORCHID
event.text: An Orchid ship sits at this beacon, where several monks also reside. It hails you. "Hello! We were looking for Zoltans of the Illesctrian faith. We were hoping that some might accompany us to our space, but they seem hesitant to agree to that. Do you think you might be able to convince them?"

Your Orchid Caretaker begins to gently talk with the monks about the lives of the Orchids, their duties and beliefs. The monks seem impressed with the ideals of your Caretaker and agree to go. "Wow, that really did the trick! Thank you for your help." The Orchids give you a modest reward for assisting them.

choice.text: (Floral Crew) Convince the Orchids to look elsewhere.

event.text: Your crewmember talks to the other Orchids and convinces them that travel of this kind is challenging for these people and that they're bound to find more eager monks if they keep looking. The Orchids apologize. The monks appreciate your intervention and give you a small tribute for helping them.

Mayeb goes to talk to the monks. "Greetings, my name is Mayeb. This is my sister, P'erpah." She gestures to her other head, which moves a little bit. "P'erpah says 'good day to you-' Ah, how do I say this... '-shiny ones of faith.'"
The monks are intrigued and begin to question Mayeb about her sister. As they talk, Mayeb gently encourages them to learn more about her people. "...and maybe, just maybe... they have some things to learn from you as well, if that's what you care about."
The monks are convinced.
"You are... a strange one, Mayeb. But, you came through for us. Thank you." The Orchids give you a small reward for assisting them.

choice.text: (Monk Crew) Talk the monks into it.

event.text: Your monk talks about the importance of spreading ideals and about how this is the way that the Great Eye is telling them that it's time to make a wider impact. At this, the Monks come around, and agree to accompany the Orchids. "Wow, that really did the trick! Thank you for your help." The Orchids give you a small reward for assisting them.
As you arm your weapons, the Orchid quickly terminates the hail and begins powering up their own weapons.
You decide not to interact with the Orchids.

You do your best to try and help them reach a compromise. Eventually, you manage to convince one of the monks to join the Orchids, if only to spare everyone else the circular conversation. "Huh, can't believe that worked. Thank you for your help." The Orchids give you a small reward for assisting them.

You do your best to try and help them reach a compromise. Even so, you end up bringing nothing to the table as you can't relate to either side. In the end, they apologize for wasting your time. It seems there's nothing more to do here.

event.name: MONK_SUN
event.text: "Welcome to your trial by fire. The Great Eye demands that we test your mettle. You must experience hardship, at least for a time. You will be forged in the crucible of suffering in order to attain true enlightenment." Looks like they plan to keep you here for a short time!

event.name: MONK_SUN_TRIAL_WIN
event.text: "Your trial is over, you have passed! Here is your reward. But take heed, the universe will no doubt have many more hardships to face. Always be attentive to the lessons of the universe."

event.name: MONK_ATONEMENT
event.text: It's rare to see Zoltan monasteries outside of the nebula. This one is positioned in the grey zone of a tidally locked planet, such that at that location, it always appears to be dawn.

"Welcome, traveler, to the light. The Illesctrian Order of Illumination observes all. However, though we look into your soul, we do not judge you. It is only by illumination that one can atone for their misdeeds." The head monk stares into your eyes with an unusually intense piercing gaze.

"Oh dear. Your soul is quite tainted. Even from a glance I can tell that you bring misery to many people. Perhaps there are some small acts of kindness that I am overlooking... but, I can tell that you are hated by many. You are on a dark path."

"You are disliked by many. I can see that you are making many enemies in your quest across the stars. I know not of the precise circumstances, but if you wish to live in peace after your little war is over, you will have to make amends."

"You are a contentious figure. Your actions consistently color you as undiplomatic and even barbaric. I am certain that there are many places you can no longer go and be welcomed, unless you make a sincere effort to change."

"Overall, you seem to have left a bad impression on this galaxy. Perhaps there are mitigating circumstances, but you seem to be sliding in the wrong direction. However, it seems you have shown at least some restraint."

"When I look into your eyes, I can see that you are in balance. If there are any acts that you have done to wrong others, it has been counterbalanced with an act of kindness or heroism. ...Or perhaps you have committed neither?"

"Ah, yes indeed. Upon looking further, you are, in fact, completely balanced. You are neither famous nor infamous. My intuition tells me you do not rock the boat. But that is wise in its own right. We offer you a gift. Go in peace, and always walk in the light."
"You have good karma overall. To noncombatants, you are more likely to bring them peace and safety than you are to exploit or bring harm to them. The light is where you belong."

"I am in awe, you seem to be quite the positive force upon the stars. For one in such a usually violent vocation, you humble me in your ability to bring positive karma to others. Perhaps we could learn a thing or two from you."
You leave the monks alone and focus on ship operations.

event.name: MONK_ATONEMENT_OFFER
event.text: "There are people out there who believe you have wronged them greatly. I do not know if you feel shame or regret over any actions you've made, or any situations you have gotten into. However, if you wish to atone for your actions, then let me offer you the chance to do so. Tell me a group you have wronged and present a donation. Once you have done so, please meditate on your wrongs towards that group."

choice.text: Atone for the misdeeds that concern nobody in particular.
Atone for the misdeeds that concern the Union.
Atone for the misdeeds that concern the Zoltan Ministry.
Atone for the misdeeds that concern the Ctl'Yae Gathering.
Atone for the misdeeds that concern the Engi Harmony.
Atone for the misdeeds that concern the Crystal Empire.
Atone for the misdeeds that concern the Outcast Rockmen.
Atone for the misdeeds that concern the Oro'bache Confederacy.
Atone for the misdeeds that concern the Free Mantis.
Atone for the misdeeds that concern the Shell Geniocracy.
Atone for the misdeeds that concern the Slug Kleptocracy.

event.text: "I see... it brings me great sorrow to hear that. However, know that it is not too late. If you ever wish to make amends, please come back, and we will do all we can to save your soul."

event.name: MONK_ATONEMENT_OFFER_GOOD_KARMA
event.text: "Although you are regarded well by most, there are people out there for whom you could have. I do not know if you feel shame or regret over any actions you've made, or any situations you have gotten into. However, if you wish to atone for your actions, then let me offer you the chance to do so. Tell me a group you have wronged. Once you have done so, please meditate on your wrongs towards that group."

choice.text: Atone for the misdeeds that concern nobody in particular.
Atone for the misdeeds that concern the Union.
Atone for the misdeeds that concern the Zoltan Ministry.
Atone for the misdeeds that concern the Ctl'Yae Gathering.
Atone for the misdeeds that concern the Engi Harmony.
Atone for the misdeeds that concern the Crystal Empire.
Atone for the misdeeds that concern the Outcast Rockmen.
Atone for the misdeeds that concern the Oro'bache Confederacy.
Atone for the misdeeds that concern the Free Mantis.
Atone for the misdeeds that concern the Shell Geniocracy.
Atone for the misdeeds that concern the Slug Kleptocracy.

event.text: "I see... Although I am disappointed, I will have faith that you are capable of making it right by your own deeds. Go in peace."

event.name: ATONEMENT_NIGHTMARE
event.text:
All is dark, and all is calm... yet, you feel as though a light has enveloped you. As you reflect on the actions that have left you infamous, you feel a creeping dread envelop you. For each of your wrongs, a pang echoes in your heart. These wrongs soon take shape, coalesce into gigantic runic cubes. These cubes swarm around you, bringing great devastation, as the light is slowly but surely blotted out. But soon, the boxes fade, and it begins to rain. No... it's not rain, it is a swarm... of locusts. As they descend upon you, they begin to eat. They devour your fingers, your arms, your legs... they keep devouring your body. But, before they envelop you completely, they scatter.
...you hear a door open.

You awake in a cold sweat. The monks help you get back to your feet. You feel as though a lot of time has passed since you closed your eyes. You notice your crew looks at you in concern, but they seem relieved that you have awoken.
The monk speaks to you again. "Your atonement has completed. The scales are balanced once more. Please take great care to embrace your moral duties. Go in peace."

event.name: MONK_CLEAN_SOUL
event.text: "How impressive, it seems that all peoples - well, aside from those who will hate you no matter what you do - have naught but good things to say about you. It pleases me that you have taken such great pains to act in kindness towards everyone. The Eye has provided us with a great artifact, we hope that it will be of use to you."

event.name: MONK_TEMPLE
event.text: This beacon appears to have been established in the orbit of a luscious, overgrown jungle planet. In the center of a giant cavern filled with flora lies a Zoltan temple. It looks relatively low tech, save for a single dormant Auto-ship protecting it.

You attempt to communicate but it appears the temple does not even have a system for receiving hails. You pilot closer and land, where a monk welcomes you. "Welcome, friends. All are welcome in this holy place, free of charge."

Most of the temple is run down and poorly maintained, with a few cheap statues here and there. A central room hosts many monks meditating in a circle. The head monk opens his eyes and greets you. "You are a visitor from the Federation? Come, join us on the path to enlightenment, and be blessed by the gods of peace."
"That's alright, friend. Safe travels."
You're curious what it's like to be a Zoltan monk, but it's not nearly as important as your mission.

choice.text: We can take the Auto-ship, raid the temple!

event.text: Once you take out the Auto-ship you'll be able to access the defenseless temple.
You have no interest in the Zoltan temple.

event.name: MONK_TEMPLE_REWARD
event.text: You take a seat on the floor amid the other Zoltans and join in with their low humming. Almost half a day passes before you are suddenly startled from your sleep and realize how much time has passed by...
The Monks briefly thank you for your visit, and as you leave you feel a strange feeling come over you... almost as if you were blessed.
As you expected, the temple is completely unable to defend themselves. Sworn to nonviolence, the monks are forced to surrender all that they have, which ends up not being much.
The monks refuse to give up their supplies. "We have no need for violence, and we will not give in to your demands. We are peaceful folk. You know better than this."
There's not much more you can do, and you aren't ready to actually kill a bunch of defenseless monks.

You've brutally murdered a bunch of innocent Zoltans, a needless slaughter as part of your petty search for scrap. What has this pointless massacre earned you? A couple fuel cells and a fake gold statue of a Zoltan meditating that isn't worth more than 3 scrap.

event.name: NEBULA_MONK_EYE_OFFERING

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: The location of the great eye, a giant monolith worshipped by the Zoltans.
beaconType.visitedTooltip: The location of the great eye, a giant monolith worshipped by the Zoltans.

event.text: As you approach the Great Eye, a rift suddenly opens and a chunk of scrap comes hurtling towards you. Fortunately it only lightly bounces off of your hull, and you scoop it up. You have no idea where it comes from, but you'll take the scrap.

event.name: NEBULA_MONK_EYE_NORMAL

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: The location of the great eye, a giant monolith worshipped by the Zoltans.
beaconType.visitedTooltip: The location of the great eye, a giant monolith worshipped by the Zoltans.

event.text: You've discovered the Great Eye! Though the location was named after the giant eye shaped nebula in the distance, the real attraction is a massive cuboid monolith with green lights resting on the nearby planet. This beacon is a well visited location by both tourists and Zoltan, who take an annual pilgrimage to this location.

event.name: MONK_EYE_OPTIONS
event.text: It is said the monolith has strange, unpredictable powers. Those who can get it to speak to them may find many wonders or horrors that await.

choice.text: Speak to the Monolith and await your fate.
You've heard the tales of beings who vanish without a trace when speaking to the Monolith... you're not interested in meeting the same fate.
Make an offering to the Great Eye.

event.text: You toss some scrap towards the Great Eye, wondering if something will occur. Unfortunately, nothing seems to. Perhaps those old Zoltan myths are false? Maybe it's worth another try?

choice.text: (Monk Crew) Pray to the Eye for a chance at better rewards.
(Obelisk Crew) Your Obelisk recognizes this structure.

event.text: "This structure was an early design of an Obelisk Reality Manipulator. You can probably guess what it does from the name. Strange it ended up here, but I suppose this explains why the monolith can supposedly do all kinds of strange things. We could bring it aboard and I can make some repairs, but I doubt the Zoltans would appreciate it."

As you bring aboard the Reality Manipulator, a Zoltan Peacekeeper stops you. "You dare disturb the Great Eye? You have insulted our entire species, not to mention the divine creators! You will be punished!"
It's tempting, but not worth the risk to mess with an item worshipped and valued so highly by the Zoltans.
Your mission is to save the Federation, not discover new wonders around the galaxy. You prepare to jump.

As you approach, an ancient alien voice speaks to you: "Your mission has brought you great battles, and great losses. This will help ease the pain." A few minutes later someone reports medical equipment has appeared on the ship!

You approach the planet carefully, trying to keep your ship from breaking up in orbit. The monolith, whatever it is, must sense as much because the next thing you know you have enough scrap to patch up your damage and more besides!

As you pull closer to the Monolith, you can hear the sounds of clanging and movement around the exterior of the ship. Confused and fearful, you pull back out of orbit and inspect the ship, but see no one. Instead, the hull has received considerable repairs!
A deep voice echoes through the ship's halls. "Your mission will be long and arduous. May this aid you, so that you shall not fear an unwarranted interruption."

Suddenly, a wormhole opens up in space, and a merchant vessel is deposited out the other side. They're confused, but upon noticing you they offer to trade, since their original clients have been left behind.
You watch in fascination as a weapon slowly fabricates in front of you, piece by piece. When nothing else happens afterwards, you safely assume that was all the monolith had to offer and pull away.

A horrific screeching can be heard from the other room. You enter to find a disgusting, small, naked creature covered in slime writhing on the ground. It rapidly begins to grow, until it develops into an adult Slug! They have no idea how they got here, but the Monolith seems to have created them for the sole purpose of serving you!
A cloud of nanobots forms around you, and a voice speaks to you. "And what purpose need you be serving?"
The nanobots form into an Separatist Engi, well trained in piloting.
The nanobots form into an Separatist Engi, well trained in shield engineering.
The nanobots form into an Separatist Engi, well trained in combat.
You approach and wait, but nothing happens. A Zoltan ship hails: "And in the coming times, when the monolith speaks not with a man he has no future and must be left wanting."

A rift opens in front of you, so huge an entire planet is thrown out of it, followed by an unhappy Lost Sun vessel! On the planet's surface appears to be a giant ASB cannon, and they're firing at both you and the enemy!

You approach the Monolith, and an alien voice fills the ship. "For every gift, something in turn must be taken." You notice your fuel stores rapidly decrease, but the scrap reserves increase for every cell depleted!

A thick gas begins to form around the ship, as a nebula consumes the beacon! A passing Zoltan ship tells you not to worry, and that this is a regular occurrence. The nebula usually goes away after a little while. Luckily, the Rebels will probably struggle to track you.
Whispers surround you, serenading you with promises of unknown riches. All you have to do is make a choice... sacrifice a crew member to receive your reward, or stay strong and resist the urge.

As soon as you accept the challenge mentally, a dagger appears in your hand. You drag the nearest crew and stab them, in a crazed bloodlust. You faint right after, only to awake and find the ship filled with scrap and supplies.

removeCrew.text: It appears that, despite their death merely being a stab wound, your crew member's death is irreversible.

event.text: After a while the whispers stop and you pull away from the planet as fast as possible.
You notice that as you approach the planet's surface, your hull slowly begins to repair itself. However, breaches open all around the ship! Every rose has its thorns...

As you approach the surface, you notice a storm of missiles flying straight towards you! As they collide with the ship, they cause considerable damage, but they also turn into scrap on impact as well. In fact, it's just enough scrap to repair all of that damage and more...
A chuckle echoes through your ship, and a disembodied voice follows. "A friend, and an enemy. An eye for an eye."

You turn to see one of your crew members coughing, grabbing at their throat as they collapse to the ground, turning purple. Slowly, their skin begins to peel away and their body melts, only to reform once again into an entirely different form.

As you approach, a kaleidoscope of colors fills the viewscreen and one of your crew begins to age rapidly in reverse, eventually disappearing into nothingness. Let's hope they've transcended physical existence, and not just been forced out of it.

removeCrew.text: You check your Cloning Bay but it lies dormant. Whatever just happened to your crewmember must be irreversible.

event.text: As you approach the monolith, you notice time around you begins to slow. You feel light headed, and faint. When you awake, it appears a considerable amount of time has passed. We'll have to hurry out of here before the Rebels catch up.
A rift opens in front of you, and a fleet of Rebel ships is dumped out the other end! A Rebel ship moves in to attack, apparently not fazed by being warped through time and space.
You notice as you approach, your shields begin to malfunction! As you attempt to leave, an asteroid field slowly approaches. A coincidence? Unlikely...

A small ball of light forms in front of your ship, and slowly begins to grow. The monolith disappears from you as you are slingshotted miles away, and the ball metamorphosizes into a sun! You get caught by the first of the solar flares, but hopefully you can escape before the next.
A portal to a dark abyss opens in front of you, and 4 aliens stumble out of it! They don't seem particuarly friendly, so you prepare to fight.
As you approach the surface, all lights on the ship suddenly blink off. A distinct clicking noise suggests that you've been boarded by the Mantis, a likely creation of the monolith, as well!

event.name: NEBULA_MONK_PEACE_QUEST
event.text: An unarmed Zoltan vessel is slowly making its way toward the beacon here. They hail: "I carry no weapons or shielding and rely on the mercy of others to communicate our message."
They continue. "I take your silence for interested contemplation." The monk talks at length about peace and harmony, but either it's beyond your simple mind or it's all nonsense.
They finish: "Please, spread the word of enlightenment to those that have not heard. Once you have, contact our brethren." They transmit coordinates of their so-called "brethren".
The galaxy is at war - there's no time for talk of peace. You leave their hails unanswered and charge the jump drive.
You charge your weapons - not that this will take much.
Just as you're preparing to attack you detect a nearby jump signature. A Zoltan defense ship comes to their aid!

event.name: MONK_PEACE_QUEST2

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: The location of the Monk's brethren.
beaconType.visitedTooltip: This was the location of the Monk's 'brethren'.

event.text: You arrive at the location specified by the peace-loving Monk, but the only thing nearby is an Elite Rebel ship, closing in fast! "We've found you! You're not getting away this time!"
They open communications: "I can't imagine there's anything you could say that will save you. The rebellion must destroy those that are still loyal to the obsolete Federation."

choice.text: "Perhaps there could be a reconciliation of our ideals without war?"

event.text: "Our ideals are too different to be so easily reconciled. You think this could end any way but war?"

choice.text: The galaxy is huge - you can find a place for your ideals elsewhere without causing this destruction.

event.text: "No! We will not be consigned to the backwaters of space just because we don't fit into your 'Federation ideals'!" They charge.

choice.text: True progress can only be achieved without bloodshed.

event.text: "You speak nonsense. We will not listen to you." They arm their weapons and attack, but perhaps you do not need to kill them. Maybe you can let them surrender, so that you may both leave this place alive?

choice.text: "Surrender. Your ultimate destruction is inevitable. We've left scores of Rebels destroyed in our wake."

event.text: They shut off communications and immediately engage.

choice.text: "Your Rebellion is causing millions of deaths. Your beliefs are dividing the galaxy. Unity is the only option!"

event.text: "Humans are treated as 'equal' to aliens in the weak Federation. The sacrifice of BILLIONS of alien or human lives are justified if it means we reach our full potential!" They charge.
You power your weapons and prepare to fight.

event.name: MONK_PEACE_QUEST_REWARD
event.text: "Although your methods are crude and most certainly ineffective, it is clear you took our previous meeting to heart. If your ship represents the Federation's willingness to adapt we shall do what we can to aid in their fight. Would you like a sample of our tech, or perhaps I could send a well trained Peacekeeper to assist you?"
